BBox2

Defines a axis-aligned bounding box (in 2D)

Members
Vector2 minPt

Minimum point defining one coroner of the bbox

Vector2 maxPt

Maximum point defining one coroner of the bbox

Header

Empty

Determines if bbox is empty

Returns true if bbox is empty. False otherwise.

AddPoint
void AddPoint(
float x,
float y
)

Adds the specified point to the bounding box. If the point is outside the bbox then the bbox's dimensions are expanded to include the point.

Parameters

float

x coordinate for point

y
float

y coordinate for point

const Vector2 &p,

)

Determines if the specified point, given some tolerance, is inside the bounding box

Parameters
p
const Vector2&

point to test

LineInside
bool LineInside(
const Vector2 &p1,
const Vector2 &p2
)

Determines if any part of the specified line is inside the bounding box

Parameters
p1
const Vector2&

first end point of line segment

p1
const Vector2&

second end point of line segment

Returns

Returns true if any part of the specified line is inside bbox. False otherwise.

BBox3

Defines a axis-aligned bounding box (in 3D)

The bounding box is assumed to be built as follows:

        +---------------+ P2
       /|              /|
      / |             / |
     /  |            /  |
    /   |           /   |
   +---------------+    |
   |    |          |    |
^  |    +----------|----+
|  |   /           |   / ^
|Y |  /            |  / /
|  | /             | / / Z
|  |/              |/ /
   +---------------+
 P1
     ---------->X

This code also assumes that the bounding volume is aligned with the coordinate system axis.

Members
Vector3 minPt

Minimum point defining one coroner of the bbox

Vector3 maxPt

Maximum point defining one coroner of the bbox

Header

Base/Math/BBox.h

Functions

)

Vector3&

top left corner for bounding box

backBottomRight

lower right corner for bounding box

Empty

Determines if bbox is empty

Returns true if bbox is empty. False otherwise.
